articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Thunberg said she joined the Madleen crew to "challenge Israel's illegal siege and escalating war crimes" in Gaza and highlight the urgent need for humanitarian aid.
articles.title: Israel orders military to stop Gaza-bound yacht carrying Greta Thunberg

articles.author: Jorge Garcia, Arafat Barbakh
articles.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has warned that the Pentagon was prepared to mobilize active-duty troops "if violence continues" in Los Angeles.
articles.title: National Guard deployed in Los Angeles amid protests against immigration raids

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's order banning citizens of 12 countries from entering the United States goes into effect at 12:01 am ET (0401 GMT) on Monday, a move the president promulgated to protect the country from "foreign terrorists."
articles.title: Trump's travel ban on 12 countries goes into effect early Monday

articles.author: Julia Cobb, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Videos showed a man identified as Uribe who appeared to be bleeding from his head. A minor under the age of 15 was arrested with a pistol.
articles.title: Surgery on Colombian senator Uribe went well after shooting, wife says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The military said troops fired warning shots at a group that was moving toward soldiers.
articles.title: Israeli military kills 4 near aid distribution site in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck Columbia on Sunday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said.
articles.title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake strikes Colombia, GFZ says

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States believes that Russian President Vladimir Putin's threatened retaliation against Ukraine over its drone attack last weekend has not happened yet in earnest and is likely to be a significant, multi-pronged strike, U.S. officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: US believes Russia response to Ukraine drone attack not over yet, expects multi-pronged strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand shortened operating hours at 10 border crossings with Cambodia, citing security concerns, as tensions between the two countries simmered after a deadly clash last month.
articles.title: Thailand cuts border crossing hours with Cambodia over security

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ecuador's National Assembly on Saturday approved a reform backed by President Daniel Noboa to arm the government with new legal powers to confront armed groups and dismantle the drug-trafficking networks that fuel their criminal enterprises.
articles.title: Ecuador national assembly passes gang-fighting reforms

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: He did not name a specific country or leader.
articles.title: Leo, the first US pope, criticises nationalist politics at Sunday Mass
